p:
Ten global climate models (GCMs) were selected from the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5 (CMIP5) archive
55, 91 based on their realism in representing California’s historical climate
47 . The Local Constructed Analogs (LOCA) statistical technique was used to downscale each GCM to 6 km resolution for daily temperature and precipitation from 1950–2100 for Representative Concentration Pathway (RCP) scenarios RCP4.5 and RCP8.5 (ref.
92 ).
